page.title: 17HOUSING IN SOUTH DERBY
page.content: The{housing}in this area is of a variety of ages and architectural styles. In the outer suburbs the houses are generally large and set in spacious gardens. The houses in the inner suburban areas were council built just prior to and immediately after second world war. The{inner {city}housing area is a mixture of late Victorian terraces, many derelict but many recently modernised, and new terraced houses, flats or maisonettes built in 1984 and 1985. Among these smaller housing units there are some large detached houses formerly belonging to the church or local business men, which have been converted into flats or bed sitting accommodation for the youth of Derby.There are also occasional bungalows snd purpose built old people's homes.
